column4: I've just tried to install Dapper on a system with 256MB of RAM
is there a way to install it without going through Live?
well that's a big step aside from FC5 style of installing
Ubuntu wants to be a Linux fro humans
it should be a way to install it directly graphical
what do you mean by goes through live?
no, you don't have to use a live cd, just download the iso of the install cd

lord_rob: these are the facts: I downloaded Desktop CD and booted from it. The menu showed and there it was the Start/Install Ubuntu. I clicked on it hopping that the installer would ask me what on earth I want: Start for trying, or Install Complete, all in graphical. But nothing of what I would have liked happened. It just started to load and load... It loaded the tryout version...
no, you don't have to use a live cd, just download the iso of the install cd
text based is not an option to show it to others
it's a text install, but that doesn't mean it's hard. You don't have to do things manually, it just doesn;t look that fancy etc.
